controller

Class DBController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.DBController

  • public class DBController
extends java.lang.Object
    DBController - input and output from the DB the DBController gets a query from the user and send it to the server it also get a file and upload it to the server or download a file from the server and gets an answer and send the results to the user.
    Author:
    Guy Cohen

      • getFile

        public static void getFile(java.lang.String bid,
                           java.lang.String format,
                           java.lang.String bookName,
                           java.lang.String path)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        this method gets a book id,book name,file format name,and a path. it gets the chosen book file from the server(witch is the book id . the wanted format in the server's computer) and opens a new file that its name is the book name and it saves it in the wanted path
        Parameters:
        bid - the book id witch is the wanted book's name
        format - the wanted format for the file
        bookName - the name of the file in the client's computer
        path - where the file is being saved
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • sendFile

        public static void sendFile(java.io.File pdf,
                            java.io.File docx,
                            java.io.File fb2)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        this metod gets 3 instances of files and write every one of them to an instace of byte[][] every byte[][] contains buffers for a whole file. every file(byte[][]) puts into an arraylist and sent to the server
        Parameters:
        pdf - an instance of File that contains a pdf file
        docx - an instance of File that contains a docx file
        fb2 - an instance of File that contains a fb2 file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
